Assignment_1's documentation!ÔÉÅ

This is the documentation of the Assignment_1 package!

Behavior ModuleÔÉÅ

This module defines the behavior of the Finite State Machine.

class scripts.behavior.CheckTarget(helper, sm_helper)[source]ÔÉÅ

Class related to the state that check the location the robot is in.

execute(userdata)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function that is executed every time the fsm enters the GO_TO_RANDOM_POSE state. It makes the robot go to the wanted location and checks it.

Parameters

userdata --

Returns

TRANS_RECHARGING(String) if the battery is low, thus transitioning to the state RECHARGING TRANS_WENT_RANDOM_POSE(String) if the battery is high, thus transitioning to the state DECIDE_LOCATION

class scripts.behavior.DecideTarget(helper, sm_helper)[source]ÔÉÅ

Class related to the state that reasons about the next location that the robot will check.

execute(userdata)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function that is executed every time the fsm enters the DECIDE_LOCATION state. It decides in which location to go next based on some criteria.

Parameters

userdata --

Returns

TRANS_RECHARGING(String) if the battery is low, thus transitioning to the state RECHARGING TRANS_DECIDED(String) is the battery is high, thus transitioning to the state GO_TO_RANDOM_POSE

class scripts.behavior.LoadOntology[source]ÔÉÅ

Class related to the state that loads the ontology.

execute(userdata)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function that is executed when entering the INITIALIZE_MAP state of the fsm. It loads the topological map and transitions to the state NORMAL.

Parameters

userdata --

Returns

transition to the next state

Return type

TRANS_INITIALIZED(String)

class scripts.behavior.Recharging(helper)[source]ÔÉÅ

Class related to the state that recharges the robot's battery.

execute(userdata)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function that is executed every time the fsm enters the RECHARGING state. It recharges the battery of the robot and transitions to the state NORMAL.

Parameters

userdata --

Returns

None

scripts.behavior.main()[source]ÔÉÅ

Main function which initalizes the Finite State Machine node 'behavior'. Two helpers are defined to help the state macine take decisions and to manage the battery. The fsm is hierarchical as to create a more modular and robust architecture.

Helper ModuleÔÉÅ

This module implements three classes representing three different helpers: one to simplify the implementation of a client for ROS action servers, one that manages the synchronization with subscribers and action servers and one to help the fsm machine taking decisions.

class scripts.helper.ActionClientHelper(service_name, action_type, done_callback=None, feedback_callback=None, mutex=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Class that simplifies the implementation of a client for ROS action servers.

cancel_goals()[source]ÔÉÅ

Fucntion to stop the computation of the action server, only if it is actually computing.

Parameters

None --

Returns

None

get_results()[source]ÔÉÅ

Function that gets the result of the action server.

Parameters

None --

Returns

result of the action server, if any, 'None' otherwise

Return type

_results(String)

is_done()[source]ÔÉÅ

Function returning whether the action server finished its computation or not. This method should be mutex safe.

Parameters

None --

Returns

'True' if the action server finished its computation, 'False' otherwise

Return type

Bool

is_running()[source]ÔÉÅ

Function returning whether the action server is running or not. This method should be mutex safe.

Parameters

None --

Returns

True if the action server is running, False otherwise

Return type

Bool

reset_client_states()[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to reset the cient state variables stored in this class.

Parameters

None --

Returns

None

send_goal(goal)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to send the action server a new goal only if it is not running; the server can be used only by one client at a time.

Parameters

goal (PlanGoal) -- goal to be sent made up of two Points, start and target in (x, y) coordinates

Returns

None

class scripts.helper.BehaviorHelper[source]ÔÉÅ

Class that implementes some function useful to the fsm to take decisions.

check_location(position, target)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to reach and check the location that the robot has to go to.

Parameters

  • position (String) -- current position of the robot, which has to be updated

  • target (String) -- location with which to update the robot position

Returns

None

decide_location()[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to decide in which location the robot will go to next.

Parameters

None --

Returns

current position of the robot target(String): string representing the location in which the robot will go to

Return type

position(String)

get_timestamp(dataprop, ind)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to get the timestamp for the 'dataprop' property of the 'ind' individual.

Parameters

  • dataprop (String) -- string representing the property for which we want the timestamp

  • ind (String) -- string representing the individual of interest

Returns

cleaned timestamp of the property of the individual

Return type

timestamp(String)

get_urgencies(reachable)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to gt the reachable urgent locations.

Parameters

reachable (List) -- list of all the reachable location

Returns

list of all the reachable locations that are urgent

Return type

reachable_urg(List)

reason_reach(reachable, position)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to decide in which location to go next. It is called when there are no urgent locations.

Parameters

  • reachable (List) -- list of all the reachable locations

  • position (String) -- string representing the current pose of the robot

Returns

string representing the location in which the robot will go to

Return type

target(String)

reason_urg(reachable_urg)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to decide how to manage the urgent locations. It is called only when there are urgent locations. The robot goes in the most urgent location, which is the one that has not been visited for the longest time.

Parameters

reachable_urg (List) -- list of all the reachable locations that are urgent

Returns

string representing the location in which the robot will go to

Return type

target(String)

recharge(position)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to recharge the battery. The robot checks the reachable location: if room E can be reached, then the robot goes there; if room E is not in the reachable locations, then choose randomly in which location to go next and repeat until room E is reachable.

Parameters

position (String) -- current position of the robot, which whill be updated with location 'E'

Returns

None

class scripts.helper.InterfaceHelper[source]ÔÉÅ

Class that manages the synchronization with subscribers and action servers.

static init_robot_pose(point)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to update the current position of the robot stored in the 'robot-state' node.

Parameters

point (Point) -- point representing the robot pose in (x, y) coordinates

Returns

None

is_battery_low()[source]ÔÉÅ

Fucntion to get the state variable encoded in this class about the battery level.

Parameters

None --

Returns

True if the battery is low, False otherwise

Return type

_battery_low(Bool)

reset_states()[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to reset the stimulus for the battery stored as state variable. This function assumes that no states of the Finite State Machine run concurrently.

Parameters

None --

Returns

None

Robot States ModuleÔÉÅ

This node has a class in which two services are defined: one to get the current robot pose and one to set it. Also, the class defines a publisher to notify that the battery is low.

class scripts.robot_states.RobotState[source]ÔÉÅ

Class implementing the services or the robot position and the publisher for the battery level.

get_pose(request)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function implementing the 'robot/get_pose' service.

Parameters

request (Point) -- given by th client as empty, it is not used

Returns

current robot position

Return type

responce(GetPoseResponce)

set_pose(request)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function implementing the 'robot/set_pose' service.

Parameters

request (Point) -- current robot position to be set

Returns

empty responce

Return type

SetPoseResponse()

Load Ontology ModuleÔÉÅ

This node adds all the wanted individuals in the map and their properties and it creates all the connections.

scripts.load_ontology.LoadMap()[source]ÔÉÅ

Function used to load all the individuals with their properties in the topological map.

Parameters
